metadata.title: CVE-2022-23303 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
The implementations of SAE in hostapd before 2.10 and wpa_supplicant before2.10 are vulnerable to side channel attacks as a result of cache accesspatterns. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix forCVE-2019-9494.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23303` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

eapoltest - 2:2.10-6ubuntu2
hostapd - 2:2.10-6ubuntu2
wpagui - 2:2.10-6ubuntu2
wpasupplicant - 2:2.10-6ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wpa package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:2.10-6ubuntu2').
